subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit Test Result Format" (XML): No evolution for years?
msgSnippet: Hi Daniela, Well, that idea definitely matches the name. :-) I m interested from the point of view of NUnit, which will have a new format for test results in
messageBody:
Hi Daniela,

Well, that idea definitely matches the name. :-)

I'm interested from the point of view of NUnit, which will have a new format for
test results in version 3.0.

Charlie

On Mon, Sep 20, 2010 at 1:01 AM, Daniela Waranie <typo3-community@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Charlie,
>
>> I'm curious... Do you view this as a JUnit format, a Java unit test
>> format or a more
>> general test reporting format?
> Due to the fact that the "JUnit test result xml format" is now used in
> many tools AND a lot of these tools are not addressed to java only the
> next version should become a language-agnostic format (just to continue
> that good process).
>
> Best regards
> Daniela Waranie
>
>
>
